content: in this legal case the harju county court made a decision after 4 years and 3 months the plaintiff referred to as mai sought to settle a claim with the defendant referred to as vm regarding the division of joint property mai proposed to divide the property with mai keeping sole ownership and vm receiving financial compensation the court ordered vm to pay the costs of the proceedings and awarded compensation to mai for procedural costs vm raised objections to the claim and submitted a response recognizing the claim but wanting to submit a counterclaim the court gave vm a deadline to file their counterclaim throughout the procedure there were preliminary hearings requests for legal aid and document submissions by both parties the court eventually terminated the granting of legal aid to vm as they were deemed able to defend their rights after examining the documents and evidence the court determined that the claim should be satisfied the court considered the circumstances and requests from both parties and made a decision based on the evidence the important facts in dispute included the marriage and joint property relationship between vm and xxxx the acquisition of a part of the property and the death of vm the plaintiff requested the division of the joint property with mai keeping sole ownership and vm receiving financial compensation the defendant accepted the claim but objected to certain aspects and filed a counterclaim for an alternative way of sharing the property the court had to consider the methods of dividing coownership and ensuring fair compensation for the coowners in conclusion the court found in favor of the plaintiffs claim and ordered the division of the property as proposed with mai keeping sole ownership and vm receiving financial compensation the courts decision was based on an extract from the land register the court also addressed procedural costs ordering the defendant to pay the plaintiffs costs the court explained the basis for awarding these costs including the state fee and legal assistance the decision on procedural costs can be challenged through an appeal
